verses.text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-1/" title="Song of Solomon 3:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-2/" title="Song of Solomon 3:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 I will rise now, and go about the city in the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-3/" title="Song of Solomon 3:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 The watchmen that go about the city found me: *to whom I said*, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-4/" title="Song of Solomon 3:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 *It was* but a little that I passed from them, but I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, until I had brought him into my mother's house, and into the chamber of her that conceived me.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-5/" title="Song of Solomon 3:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake *my* love, till he please.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-6/" title="Song of Solomon 3:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Who *is* this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant?

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-7/" title="Song of Solomon 3:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Behold his bed, which *is* Solomon's; threescore valiant men *are* about it, of the valiant of Israel.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-8/" title="Song of Solomon 3:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 They all hold swords, *being* expert in war: every man *hath* his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-9/" title="Song of Solomon 3:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-10/" title="Song of Solomon 3:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 He made the pillars thereof *of* silver, the bottom thereof *of* gold, the covering of it *of* purple, the midst thereof being paved *with* love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-3-11/" title="Song of Solomon 3:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals, and in the day of the gladness of his heart.
